intro: Lavandula sublepidota, commonly known as narrow-leaved lavender, is a species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and spikes of purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Lavandula sublepidota is often cultivated for its ornamental value and mild aromatic properties.
